summary: This document is a chain of emails between attorneys and paralegals, primarily Jeanne M. Christensen and an unnamed recipient, discussing the sharing of evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein. The evidence includes a 2012 journal with entries from more than 20 people, and photos allegedly showing Epstein (JE) with a young woman on a boat in Oak Bluffs, Martha's Vineyard, reportedly taken by Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Creation of Evidentiary Journal
events.description: A journal from 2012 is referenced as evidence. It contains entries from more than 20 contemporaneous writers, and their contact information is held.

events.title: Oak Bluffs Boat Photos
events.description: Photos were taken allegedly showing Jeffrey Epstein on a boat with a young blond woman in Oak Bluffs harbor, Martha's Vineyard. The photos were reportedly taken by Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Evidence Sharing Correspondence
events.description: A series of emails between legal professionals arranging the secure transfer of evidence, including the 2012 journal and the boat photos.

locations: 85 Fifth Avenue, New York, NY 10003 (Wigdor Law office)
keyFacts: A 2012 journal exists as evidence, containing entries from more than 20 people whose contact information is available.
Photos allegedly show Jeffrey Epstein (JE) with a young blond woman on a boat in Oak Bluffs, Martha's Vineyard.
The client alleges Ghislaine Maxwell took these photos.
The email chain shows active legal work in March 2024 to share this evidence between legal teams.
The correspondence is marked as potentially containing Confidential or Attorney-Client Privileged Information.
